intro: [WRONG START] Peganum harmala var. grandiflorum, commonly known as the desert cowplant, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a shrub characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and thick, waxy leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain toxic seeds, which can be harmful if ingested. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its botanical features reflect its adaptation to harsh, dry climates.
